snippet: With the opening of a new ice skating complex in Prospect Park in Brooklyn, curling, last popular in New York City in the 1800s, is being warmly welcomed.
abstract: Brooklynites are expressing new enthusiasm for curling, sport involving ice, brooms and rocks, following opening of new LefraK Center ice skating complex in Prospect Park; sport, which was last popular there in the 1800s, is part of retro pastime boom in the borough.
lead_paragraph: With the opening of a new ice skating complex in Prospect Park in Brooklyn, curling, last popular in New York City in the 1800s, is being warmly welcomed.

headline.seo: The Sport of Curling Finds a New Popularity in Brooklyn
headline.main: In the Borough of Beards, Lay Down Some Ice, and Out Come the Brooms
headline.print_headline: With Arrival of New Ice, Borough of Enthusiasts Breaks Out the Brooms
